url.metaDescription: Create free QR codes for URLs and text.
url.heroSubtitle: No sign-up. No expiration. Instant download.
url.heroDescription: Create QR codes for your website, link, or any text.

bodyContent.subheading: What can you encode in a QR code?
paragraphs: QR codes can store URLs, plain text, contact cards (vCard), Wi-Fi credentials, WhatsApp links, and SMS messages. Enter your content above and the QR code generates instantly.
Use URLs for websites, landing pages, or app download links. Use plain text for short messages, codes, or instructions. The generator supports multiple formats—switch tabs to explore.

bodyContent.subheading: How to use your QR code
paragraphs: Download the QR code as PNG for screens and documents, or SVG for print. Choose a size that fits your use case: 256px or 384px for digital, 512px or 1024px for print.
Scan with your phone to test before sharing or printing. No expiration—static QR codes work forever. Your data never leaves your browser.

howToSteps.stepTitle: Step 1: Enter your URL or text
howToSteps.stepDescription: Paste your link or type your message in the input field above. The QR code generates in real time as you type. Choose URL for websites, or Plain text for short messages.

howToSteps.stepTitle: Step 2: Choose your QR code size
howToSteps.stepDescription: Select a size that fits your use case: 256px or 384px for digital use (screens, emails), 512px for general print, or 1024px and up for high-quality print. Larger sizes ensure reliable scanning.
Click the Download PNG button to save your QR code. Use PNG for screens and documents, or SVG for vector/print. No sign-up required. Scan with your phone to test before printing.

vcard-qr-generator.metaTitle: Free vCard QR Code Generator for Business Cards — No Sign-Up
vcard-qr-generator.metaDescription: Create free vCard QR codes for business cards. Scan to save contact on iPhone and Android. Add name, phone, email, company. No sign-up, no expiration.
vcard-qr-generator.heroSubtitle: No sign-up. No expiration. Instant download.
vcard-qr-generator.heroDescription: Create "Scan to Save Contact" QR codes for iPhone and Android.

bodyContent.subheading: What is a vCard QR Code?
paragraphs: A vCard QR code encodes your contact information (name, phone, email, company, website) in a format that smartphones recognize. When someone scans it with their camera, they get the option to save the contact directly to their address book.
This is ideal for business cards, event badges, restaurant tables, or anywhere you want people to add your details without typing.

bodyContent.subheading: How to Create a vCard QR Code
paragraphs: Enter your contact details in the form above. Include at least your name and either a phone number or email so people can reach you. Add a company name and website for a professional touch.
The QR code updates in real time. Download it as PNG for digital use or SVG for print. Your data never leaves your browser—everything is generated locally.

howToSteps.stepDescription: Fill in first name, last name, phone, email, company, and website. Include at least your name and phone or email. The QR code updates in real time.

howToSteps.stepTitle: Step 2: Choose size and optional logo
howToSteps.stepDescription: Select a size for your QR code. Add a logo in Settings if desired. vCard QR codes work best at 256px or larger.
Download as PNG or SVG. Print on business cards, display at events, or share digitally.

whatsapp-qr-generator.metaTitle: Free WhatsApp QR Code Generator — Instant Link | No Sign-Up
whatsapp-qr-generator.metaDescription: Create WhatsApp QR codes that open a chat with a pre-filled message. Free, instant, no sign-up. Use for support, orders, or marketing.
whatsapp-qr-generator.heroSubtitle: No sign-up. No expiration. Instant download.
whatsapp-qr-generator.heroDescription: Create QR codes that open WhatsApp with a pre-filled message.

bodyContent.subheading: What is a WhatsApp QR Code?
paragraphs: A WhatsApp QR code encodes a link that opens WhatsApp and starts a chat with your number. You can optionally add a default message (e.g., "Hi! I'd like to order" or "I need support") so customers don't have to type anything.
Scanning the code works on iPhone and Android. If WhatsApp isn't installed, users are prompted to install it or continue in the browser.

bodyContent.subheading: Use Cases for WhatsApp QR Codes
paragraphs: Use them on flyers, menus, packaging, and business cards to drive conversations. Restaurants can add "Order via WhatsApp" codes on tables. Retailers can use them for customer support. Events can offer a quick way to join a group or contact organizers.
Always include the country code (e.g., +1 for US) so the link works internationally.

howToSteps.stepTitle: Step 1: Enter your phone number and message
howToSteps.stepDescription: Add your WhatsApp number with country code. Optionally add a default message that opens when someone scans.
Select a size that fits your placement—256px for digital, 512px or larger for print.
Download as PNG or SVG. Use on menus, flyers, or business cards.

wifi-qr-generator.metaTitle: Free Wi-Fi QR Code Generator — One-Scan Connect | No Sign-Up
wifi-qr-generator.metaDescription: Create a QR code that lets guests connect to your Wi-Fi with one scan. Perfect for restaurants, cafes, and hotels. No sign-up. Free and instant.
wifi-qr-generator.heroSubtitle: No sign-up. No expiration. Instant download.
wifi-qr-generator.heroDescription: Let guests connect to your Wi-Fi with one scan.

bodyContent.subheading: What is a Wi-Fi QR Code?
paragraphs: A Wi-Fi QR code encodes your network name (SSID) and password in a standard format. When someone scans it, their phone recognizes the Wi-Fi credentials and offers to join the network—no typing required.
This is perfect for cafes, hotels, offices, and homes. Guests scan, tap "Join," and they're connected.

Choose the correct security type (WPA/WPA2, WEP, or None for open networks). Most modern routers use WPA or WPA2. The QR code works on iPhone and Android without any app—the built-in camera handles it.
Print the code and place it where guests can easily scan it, or display it on a screen. No expiration—the code stays valid as long as your Wi-Fi credentials don't change.

howToSteps.stepDescription: Add network name (SSID), choose security type, and enter the password. The QR code generates as you type.
Select 512px or larger for print on tables or signs.
Download as PNG or SVG. Print and place where guests can scan.

qr-code-reader.metaTitle: Online QR Code Reader — Scan from Image, Screen, or Camera
qr-code-reader.metaDescription: Free, no-sign-up QR code scanner. Upload an image or use your camera to decode any QR code instantly in your browser. 100% private.
qr-code-reader.heroSubtitle: Scan from image, screen, or camera. 100% private.
qr-code-reader.heroDescription: Upload a QR code image or use your camera. Decoding happens in your browser—nothing is sent to any server.

paragraphs: Upload an image (PNG, JPG, or SVG) or click "Scan with Camera" to use your device camera. The scanner uses jsQR to decode the QR code in your browser. Results appear instantly.
Your image and camera feed stay entirely in your browser. No data is sent to our servers or any backend. Decoding runs locally—100% private.

sms-qr-generator.metaTitle: Free SMS QR Code Generator — Pre-filled Messages | No Sign-Up
sms-qr-generator.metaDescription: Create QR codes that open the SMS app with a phone number and message pre-filled. Free, instant, no sign-up. Works on iPhone and Android.
sms-qr-generator.heroSubtitle: No sign-up. No expiration. Instant download.
sms-qr-generator.heroDescription: Create QR codes that open the SMS app with number and message pre-filled.

bodyContent.subheading: What is an SMS QR Code?
paragraphs: An SMS QR code encodes a link that opens the default SMS app with a phone number and optional message already filled in. The user taps send—or edits the message first—and the text goes out.
This is useful for campaigns, feedback requests, support hotlines, and anywhere you want to lower friction for sending a text.
Include the country code for international compatibility. Keep the pre-filled message short and actionable (e.g., "Yes, sign me up" or "I need help with my order").
Use on posters, receipts, packaging, and ads. The QR code works on any smartphone with a camera and messaging app.

howToSteps.stepTitle: Step 1: Enter phone number and message
howToSteps.stepDescription: Add the phone number with country code and optionally a pre-filled message.
Select a size that fits your placement.
Download as PNG or SVG. Use on posters, receipts, or ads.
